abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Lima Transport Project
            for Peru were as follows: outcomes were satisfactory; GEO
            outcomes were moderately satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was low or negligible; risk to GEO outcome was
            moderate; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: strengthen project implementation
            agency's capacity for mainstreaming environmental and
            social management into urban transport project preparation
            and supervision. Enhance the Bank's due diligence on
            compliance with environmental and social safeguard policies,
            including consultation and communications, during
            supervision. Consider at appraisal key elements that are
            likely to facilitate the successful implementation of
            complex Bus Rapid Transit (BRT) projects. Focus on the
            ridership target strategy in order to achieve financial
            sustainability prior to pre-operation of the system or
            during the first year of operation. Project design should
            not be focused on a single BRT line: it must contain a
            broader sectoral approach that considers a long-term vision
            of the urban transport sector in the city. Project design
            should reflect the agreements with the Borrower and include
            studies to examine possibly complex policy issues.
